Hi

How do I connect the Rio and terminate the Can bus if I am using the CTRE PDP 2.0

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T16:19:34.525Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":347,"readers_count":346,"score":99.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494739,"topic_slug":"the-new-ctre-power-distribution-board-2-0-wiring","display_username":"Tio","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28847,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/the-new-ctre-power-distribution-board-2-0-wiring/494739/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551226,"name":"Ezra","username":"Strflightmight","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strflightmight/{size}/261969_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T16:26:24.622Z","cooked":"

The PDP 2.0 doesn‚Äôt support CAN bus termination, you can‚Äôt connect it to the Rio, but you could connect the CAN bus to a 120 Ohm resistor for termination

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-08T16:26:24.622Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":346,"readers_count":345,"score":84.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494739,"topic_slug":"the-new-ctre-power-distribution-board-2-0-wiring","display_username":"Ezra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62434,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 | Programmer, Electronics Lead, and Driver"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-ctre-power-distribution-board-2-0-wiring/494739/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3551319,"name":"Gus Michel II","username":"GeeTwo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geetwo/{size}/120962_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-08T19:09:20.984Z","cooked":"

If you don‚Äôt have a shop that sells resistors close by, or an electronics hobbyist around who can spare a few, Andy Mark has them.

andymark.com

CAN Terminating Resistor

The CAN terminating resistor is used to terminate the can bus that the Talon SRX, Victor SRX, and other FRC components use to communicate. The manufacture part number is; SFR16S0001200JA500. To wire a CAN bus, connect a yellow signal wire to the CAN...

Full Disclosure: through my investment club, I have stock in Vishay Precision Group, who I just discovered makes the resistors AndyMark sells. We voted to increase our holdings a by a few hundred dollars on Thursday.
OBTW, the color code is .

You need to power the rio off of one of the standard ports, but put in the appropriate breaker. Same with your voltage regulator.

You can also get 120 Ohm resistors from Amazon. Get ones rated for at least 1/4 W. Otherwise, they get rather small and the lead wires are very thin, making them harder to work with.

Return it and get a PDP 1.0 or a PDH from Rev.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T14:58:48.751Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":52.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494739,"topic_slug":"the-new-ctre-power-distribution-board-2-0-wiring","display_username":"Brian Rozmierski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC Volunteer / Former 5881 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/the-new-ctre-power-distribution-board-2-0-wiring/494739/9","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552785,"name":"Brian Rozmierski","username":"bdaroz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bdaroz/{size}/128636_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T15:26:34.763Z","cooked":"

So‚Ä¶ before everyone piles-on the thumbs down, take a look through the posts announcing this product. The lack of CAN bus, or current sensing on this product was identified early on as a potential problem for low-resource/rookie teams. Not because of the lack of a resistor, but because of the lack of current sensing.

As a CSA I already had issues this last week with a team that had one and was using swerve drive but one of their motors ‚Äúlocked up‚Äù or ‚Äúsounded funny‚Äù during a match. One of the exact cases where seeing current monitoring on that motor would have help troubleshooting.

Yes, they can get that data from their motor controller and log it via any number of logging tools, but they didn‚Äôt have that aready set up, so the data was, in effect, lost.

Unless you‚Äôre a team that already has robust logging in place, and is willing to take the responsibility of adding/logging this as well, this is not the product you want, and unless you do, I do not recommend anyone purchase/use it.
